cs213.photoAlbum.control
Interface Control

All Known Implementing Classes:
Controller
public interface Control

The Control interface will handle all algorithmic logic, decision making, and data manipulation processes. The following methods allow full functionality of the Photo Album application.

Author:
dryu

boolean createAlbum(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new album with the given name and adds it to the Current user's album list.

Returns:
True if the operation is successful, false if the album already exists.

listPhotos

java.util.ArrayList<Photo> listPhotos(java.lang.String albumName)
Returns a list of photos inside of the album with the given album name.

Returns:
ArrayList of photo objects or null if the album does not exist.

addPhoto

int addPhoto(java.lang.String filename,
             java.lang.String caption,
             java.lang.String albumName,
             java.io.File pic)
Adds a photo with the given name and caption to the chosen album.

Returns:
1 = photo was successfully added. 2 = photo already exists in album. 3 = album does not exists

movePhoto

int movePhoto(java.lang.String filename,
              java.lang.String oldAlbumName,
              java.lang.String newAlbumName)
Moves a photo with given filename from one album to another.

Returns:
-1 = old album doesn't exist. -2 = new album doesn't exist. -3 = photo doesn't exist in old album. -4 = photo already exists in new album. 1 = succesful move of photo.

removePhoto

boolean removePhoto(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String album)
Removes a photo from a specified album.

Returns:
True if successful, false if the photo doesn't exist.

addTag

int addTag(java.lang.String filename,
           java.lang.String tagType,
           java.lang.String tagValue)
Adds a tag with to a specified photo with a tag type and value.

Returns:
1 = Successfully added the tag. -1 tag already exists for the file with the tag type and value. -2 = failure of other reasons.

deleteTag

int deleteTag(java.lang.String filename,
              java.lang.String tagType,
              java.lang.String tagValue)
Deletes a tag with a type and value from a specified photo.

Returns:
1 = tag deleted successfully. -1 = tag does not exist for the photo with the given tag type and value. -2 = other reasons for failure.

listPhotoInfo

Photo listPhotoInfo(java.lang.String photoName)
list the information for a photo with the given name. Information includes list of albums it is found in, list of tags, and a caption. The list is sorted by tag type in the order location, people, others, and sorted by tag value within each type)

Returns:
a photo object or null if it does not exist.

getPhotosByDate

java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getPhotosByDate(java.lang.String startDate,
                                           java.lang.String endDate)
                                           throws java.text.ParseException
Takes a start date and end date and input and returns a list sorted in chronological order of all the photos that have a date field between those dates

Throws:
java.text.ParseException

getPhotosByTag

java.util.ArrayList<Photo> getPhotosByTag(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tagValues)
Takes a list of tag values and returns a list of photos that have the specified tag values. The list is sorted in chronological order according to the date of the photos.

logout

void logout()
Attempts to save the user list containing all the information on users, albums, photos and tags, and then exists the program.

Returns the latest (most recent) date of a photo within an album of the given album name.

java.lang.String getStartDate(Album album)
Returns the earliest (oldest) date of a photo within an album of the given album name.
